findings.Lower Thorax: The lung bases are clear. No pleural or pericardial effusion.
findings.Liver: Heterogeneous in signal characteristics with a 10 x 10 mm focus in segment 2, non-enhancing and hyperintense on T2 images, likely a small cyst or biliary hamartoma. No concerning solid or cystic lesions.
findings.Biliary: No intra- or extra-hepatic duct dilatation. Cholelithiasis and mild pericholecystic free fluid with no gallbladder wall edema. A 13 mm calculus in the cystic duct, which is dilated measuring up to 15 mm.
findings.Pancreas: Normal bulk and enhancement pattern with scattered pancreatic cysts ranging from 1 to 3 mm, likely representing a side-branch IPMN.
findings.Spleen: Normal in size and signal characteristics with no focal lesions.
findings.Adrenal Glands: Normal in size and signal characteristics with no focal lesions.
findings.Kidneys: Normal in size and signal characteristics, with no solid or cystic lesions, hydronephrosis, or hydroureter.
findings.Vasculature: Conventional hepatic arterial anatomy with mild atherosclerosis throughout the abdominal aorta.
findings.Osseous and Soft Tissue Structures: Mild multilevel degenerative change throughout the thoracolumbar spine with normal signal characteristics in the bone marrow and no concerning osseous lesions.
